ratings.comment: She is awesome!!! Go to office hours, she knows almost everybody who goes regularly and she has like 50 people show up. Not only did I get a good grade, but I also felt as though I thoroughly learned the material. Absolutely take her!!
The lecture preparation quizzes are tough and require you to read into the topic in depth before it is taught. Responds to emails quickly. Very organized.
She is the best professor I have ever had. Write very fast but clear, and the examples are helpful for learning. So said she is leaving :(

Jen really knows how to teach calculus. She was energetic and engaging in lectures. Her office hours were also invaluable, as they were almost like mini discussion sections. She cares about each one of her students and really wants you to understand the material and do well. If I could have her as the professor for all of my math classes, I would.
Jen was awesome for 521. Though the class was challenging, she worked hard to make it enjoyable.
One of the best math instructors I've ever had. Don't hesitate to sign up for calculus 2 with her. Cleary explains concepts in such a way that they stick in your head.

Jen is by far the best math professor I've ever had at UW Madison. She's very easy to understand and makes sure that the class is following along during lectures. Office hours with her are the only reason I understood this material, as she is super helpful one on one. I was blown away by how dedicated Jen is to teaching!

Jen brings a lot of energy to lectures, and explains things very well. She's always helpful when it comes to any type of question, and she really wants you to do well. Her feedback is fantastic, and going to office hours are worth it. If you have the opportunity to take a class with her, do it -- you will get a lot from it.

I truly enjoyed jens class. Very energetic and personable especially in small lecture setting. Gets to know each student. Presents the material in a very clear fashion. Would take again without hesitation.
She is a great and engaging teacher, exams are tough.  Make sure to really understand the HW

Jen is one of the best 222 profs out there. She's clear, always provides step-by-step solutions to problems, and makes lecture entertaining (which is hard to do when you have calculus from 8-9:15 AM). I personally struggled with the material and exams were tough but lectures were very helpful and if you work hard, you'll be rewarded.

Jen has really good lectures that make the material as clear as it could be. Personally,  I found several aspects of the course to be very challenging, but with some hard work and going to every lecture, I was able to pull an A. She is a great professor that does all she can to help you understand a very difficult subject.
Perfect, her energy inspires me

Jen is the best professor you can possibly get for such a hard class. She is always enthusiastic, energetic and hilarious which makes the material so much easier to learn. She gives clear, step-by-step approaches to every problem and really helps you understand the material. Honestly, best prof I've had here and very helpful at office hours.

Jen is an AMAZING professor. Her class was at the ungodly hour of 8AM but it was definitely worth the sleep deprivation. She made MAT222 incredibly relatable. Her lectures were very clear and she made a difficult subject pretty bearable. Would strongly recommend taking her for MAT222.

So I took Math 221 at UW with Mari-Beffa and had the worst experience. I thought it was because I was stupid and would never be good at math but I gave it another shot and took Beichman's class - best decision of my life! She makes math fun and enjoyable and is really professional while also extremely helpful. Just a great educator overall.
Very clear lecture, and challenging homework sets, the exams are fair.

Jen did not have high ratings on here last semester and I was nervous to be in her class. She is an awesome math teacher. Takes the complex material in Math 222 and makes it easy to understand. Tests are really hard but are curved generously (4060 on the final gave me an A). She's very helpful when you talk to her one on one.

She's very comprehensive and clear. Her lectures are very easy to take notes on and she has a good sense of humor so the lectures aren't so tough to get through. You still need to put the work in though, as the class is pretty hard. Take notes and go to lecture.

write and speak clearly in class. Compared to others, she is a good instructor. but a low percent of A in her class.The exams become more and more difficult. the final is a nightmare. began at 7:45am and extremely difficult. So if you need to do well in the midterms to get a good letter grade finally.
Probably the best lecturer I've had at Madison. She explains things very well, and is funny enough to keep everybody interested. She is very fair and shows interest in helping her students.
Very good lecturer, explains things in many different ways and makes sure the class understands concepts. Midterms are hard but partial credit is given and if you study they're really not that bad
Helpful, enthusiastic, and friendly. Very accommodating of re-scheduling exams, office hours were really useful. Would reccomend.
I like this professor so much. She writes on blackboard very clearly and speaks clearly. Fair exam. Super Recommand
Class notes and examples are very clear and helpful. Kept me awake even during long power lectures. Very open to students' questions and re-explaining anything that was unclear. Exams are fair.

Class material was hard if you haven't had much experience with math proofs before. However, Jen really wants you to learn and her class and exams are fair.  Her office hours and lectures  were well organized and helpful. Jen even took the time to learn everyone's name in the class.
Jen is a very good instructor who brings a lot of energy to her lectures.  Would recommend.
